beer_brewer_name: Port Brewing Co / The Lost Abbey
review_blob:
Even with being likely handled improperly, we don't get really much barrel-aged qualities. Surprising lack of sweetness too. Not a bad beer, but certainly not worth more than about $6-8. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Lots of sediment. 
Poor head retention. 
Initial reaction was better than final impression. 
Probably handled poorly after leaving the brewery.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A wonderful Jewbelation and another grand slam for my love of heavy, complex beers!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottled: 21 Sep 2012
443 cases produced
7.10% ABV
Aged in Cabernet Sauvignon barrels for 12 months
3 Sacchromyces strains, 3 Brettanomyces strains, lactobacillus, and pediococcus used

Subtle raspberry, but clearly present, i.e. wonderfully balanced. 


---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Better than I remember. 
Good beer to research for recipe development. ABV higher than I'd like though. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

If Im forced to drink a Pabst/Bud/Miller/Coors-like lager, Id much rather make it this beer--but I dont go for bland, light beer in general.  Its not a bad beer, its just not an interesting beer.  Fat Tire would be my idea of an easy-drinkin session from New Belgium.  But, Im a person that can drink a stout or Trippel out in the heat of a hot summer day too--I also dont drink alcohol when I mow the yard either.  That said, I hope it becomes as popular as Pabst!  Love the package design though.
